Yes, Catholic University of America is keeping pace with emerging fields such as artificial intelligence and cybersecurity. The university has introduced several programs that reflect the technological trends and market demands of contemporary society.

For instance, the university's School of Engineering has introduced a new Master of Science in Cybersecurity Engineering program. This program teaches students about cybersecurity principles and engineering methods and aims to produce engineers who can address the advanced cybersecurity threats of today and tomorrow. 

The university also offers undergraduate and graduate programs that incorporate artificial intelligence, such as the Bachelor of Science in Data Science and the Master of Science in Business Analytics.

Catholic University of America emphasizes a holistic education that integrates intellectual inquiry, ethical reasoning, and spiritual formation. Therefore, the university aims to incorporate the Catholic values of social responsibility, ethical judgment, and human dignity into these emerging fields. They also believe that new technologies offer opportunities to serve others and promote the common good. 

For example, Catholic University of America emphasizes the responsible use of artificial intelligence to serve humanity, and they encourage research that aligns with the university's mission of using knowledge to advance the common good. 

In sum, Catholic University of America is keeping up with technological trends and market demands by introducing programs in emerging fields such as artificial intelligence and cybersecurity, while also integrating Catholic values into these fields to prepare students to be technology leaders who serve the world with integrity and compassion.
